Damian

________________________________
From: "Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"
To: Comet Group
Sent: Thursday, 7 August 2014, 12:41
Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet Jacques C/2014 E2 - Finally a monsoon clearing!

Greetings cometary Friends,

The rains have stopped for a few days, and after a long planned shooting session yesterday morning, I will have the data to assemble a color 2 part panorama. While in process, I thought Id post the L channel from the first panel to show you. The number of stars in this part of Auriga is staggering! Over the next few days Ill be trying to tone them down a bit for the final two part that includeds 8 degrees of tail. Thanks for looking:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques080614a.html

PS - an interesting processing challenge on the panorma, the comets head is not in the second field and so when stacking, there is nothing to align on but stars...

Clear Skies,

Chris

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Thu, 07 Aug 2014 11:54:27 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet Jacques C/2014 E2 - Finally a monsoon clearing!
Thanks Damian!

Clear Skies,

Chris

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

From:
"Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"


To: Comet
Group

Sent:
Thursday, 7 August 2014, 12:41
Subject: [Comet-Images]
Comet Jacques C/2014 E2 - Finally a monsoon clearing!

Greetings cometary Friends,

The rains have stopped for a few days, and after a long
planned shooting session yesterday morning, I will have the
data to assemble a color 2 part panorama. While in process,
I thought Id post the L channel from the first panel to show
you. The number of stars in this part of Auriga is
staggering! Over the next few days Ill be trying to tone
them down a bit for the final two part that includeds 8
degrees of tail. Thanks for looking:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques080614a.html

PS - an interesting processing challenge on the panorma, the
comets head is not in the second field and so when stacking,
there is nothing to align on but stars...

Clear Skies,

Chris

Schur's Web Portal:
http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Thu, 07 Aug 2014 21:44:49 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2012 X1 LINEAR with IC 5201 - Aug 6th.
Hi all,

Yep its still there...this comet seems to have been around for a long time!

C/2012 X1 among the stars of Grus alongside the spiral galaxy IC 5201. Various other galaxies are scattered across the field. Also note the lovely double star just left of the galaxy.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2012_x1_2014_08_06dp.jpg

FSQ106 with STL-11k. LRGB. L: 21mins. RGB: 3mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Newton 140/f-400 2x360sec 2x2 bin blue
Moravian G3-11002

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140808ut202s2x360web_1407483609.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140808ut202s2x360web_1407483609.jpg

Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 12:36:54 +0200
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2014-08-07  17P  95P C2013V5 C2014E2 P2014L3
Dear all

5 comets observed during the second half of the night, with the Moon low
on the SW horizon or set.

17P/Holmes
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/17P_Holmes.html

95P/Chiron
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/95P_Chiron.html

C/2013 V5 (Oukaimeden)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2013V5_Oukaimeden.html

C/2014 E2 (Jacques)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2014E2_Jacques.html

P/2014 L3 (Hill)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/P2014L3_Hill.html

Best

Luc 
Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 06:33:50 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Jacques - the final color image from the 6th...
Greetings all,

Many stars in this field! I did not like the way the median came out, the stars were very strange looking. However I used it to bring up the very faint tail by combining it using lighten with the summed image with the trailed stars. This techniqe really brings up tails lost in the star field. Hope you like:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques080614.html

Clear Skies,

Chris

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 14:36:49 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  C/2014 E2 7 Aug.  2014  unfiltered close up
Hello,

An image of 2014E2 today morning from my observatory, prime focus on my C11.The guiding was not good but a decent image came out.Unfiltered.

http://kardasis.weebly.com/comets.html

Manos Kardasis
Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 16:51:49 +0200
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2014 E2: a nice video showing fast evolution in the ion tail (8 Aug. 2014)
Dear All,

here is a video (plus image) showing comet Jacques as from this morning. It
shows a very fast evolution in the ion tail:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/08/08/comet-c2014-e2-jacques-image-amazing-video-8-aug-2014/

Best
Gianluca

On Fri, 8/8/14, michaeljaeger@gmx.at [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] 2014 E2 and open cluster NGC 1582 Aug 8
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, August 8, 2014, 1:01 AM

Hello
Image from this morning - Aug. 8 UT
2.02Newton 140/f-400 2x360sec 2x2 bin
blueMoravian G3-11002
http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140808ut202s2x360web_1407483609.jpg
Best RegardsMichael Jäger 

Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 10:30:56 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014-08-07  17P  95P C2013V5 C2014E2 P2014L3
Nice Luc. It will be interesting to see how my shot this morning compares to your 17P shot.

Clear Skies,

Chris

On Fri, 8/8/14, Luc ARNOLD luc.arnold@orange.fr [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] 2014-08-07 17P 95P C2013V5 C2014E2 P2014L3
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, August 8, 2014, 3:36 AM

Dear all

5 comets observed during the second half of the night,
with the Moon
low on the SW horizon or set.

17P/Holmes

http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/17P_Holmes.html

95P/Chiron

http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/95P_Chiron.html

C/2013 V5 (Oukaimeden)

http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2013V5_Oukaimeden.html

C/2014 E2 (Jacques)

http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2014E2_Jacques.html

P/2014 L3 (Hill)

http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/P2014L3_Hill.html

Best

Luc 

Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 21:27:58 +0200
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014-08-07  17P  95P C2013V5 C2014E2 P2014L3
Thanks Chris
I'll have a look to your image as soon as it'll be on line.
I noticed that faint stars seem blended with the coma in my image,
giving the coma a slighlty elongated shape.
I'll probably try to observe it again tomorrow morning.
Best
Luc

Date:  Sat, 09 Aug 2014 09:55:05 +1000
From:  Alan Watson 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 E2: a nice video showing fast evolution in the ion tail (8 Aug. 2014)
Good effort there Gianluca,
you beat Michael to an animation.. 8)

Might I suggest , if you don't need to really measure any of the levels in
your images.
If you make a min image from your sequence of 21 images and subtract this
from each image.
Then log scale each image, and then square scale the result of this. Adjust
the brigthness and contrast.
Make an anim of this result. I think this will show the tail details a bit
more, and hopefully the dynamics also.

kind regards, Alan Watson

Date:  Fri, 08 Aug 2014 23:47:23 -0700
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  C/2014 E2 Aug. 8 LRGB
Hello

Moon is in the land, Time for image processing.

August 8 UT 1.30

L-2x240sec 2x2 bin filter UV/IR
2x360sec 2x2 bin blue
2x300sec 3x3 bin blue

RGB 300/300/300 sec 3x3 bin

Newton 140/f-400
CCD Moravian G3-11002

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140808lrgbweb_2_1407566289.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140808lrgbweb_2_1407566289.jpg

Best Regards
Michael Jäger 
Date:  Sat, 09 Aug 2014 13:51:51 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  Comet 2013A2 (Siding Spring)
Hello,

Hello here is my first image from i-telescope.net of the Comet 2013A1(Siding Spring) made from Australia.Thanks to Jeff Woods(i-telescope) for recognizing the debris item.

http://kardasis.weebly.com/comets.html

Instrument details:

CCD: SBIG ST2000XMC,no filters
Telescope Takahashi SKY90,Focal Length: 417mm,F/Ratio: f/4.6
Date:  Sat, 09 Aug 2014 16:20:43 +0200
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  comet C/2012 X1 Linear 08/08/14
http://www.astrobin.com/full/112398/0/

in this picture you can see the Comet C/2012 X 1 surrounded by a dense field of
galaxies and near the Gru alpha star, Alnair

regards
Rolando Ligustri

#yiv6418875602 div.yiv6418875602file-title a, #yiv6418875602
div.yiv6418875602file-title a:active, #yiv6418875602
div.yiv6418875602file-title a:hover, #yiv6418875602
div.yiv6418875602file-title a:visited {
text-decoration:none;}

#yiv6418875602 div.yiv6418875602photo-title a,
#yiv6418875602 div.yiv6418875602photo-title a:active,
#yiv6418875602 div.yiv6418875602photo-title a:hover,
#yiv6418875602 div.yiv6418875602photo-title a:visited {
text-decoration:none;}

font-family:Verdana;font-size:10px;font-weight:normal;}

color:#628c2a;}

margin:0 0 0 0;}

font-size:0;}

float:left;width:72px;}

border:1px solid
#666666;height:62px;overflow:hidden;width:62px;}

font-size:inherit;font:100%;}

Newton 140/f-400  mosaic two fields, each 2x360 3x3 bin filter blue

Yes. However, the comet should be high.
It does not work when the comet is close to the horizon.

Michael

Date:  Fri, 15 Aug 2014 00:31:04 +0200
From:  Matej Mihelčič 
Subject:  C/2014E2 Jacques
Dear,

My color image of comet Jacques made on 08.08.2014 at 1:15UT from small
hill in central part of Slovenia near capital city Ljubljana where
observing conditions of course are not ideal for faint sky objects. Images
taken with *Gemini Telesope Design G53F* + GSO 20cm f4 + G2-8300 LRGB

http://astronomska-revija-spika.si/matej/C2014E2-JACQUES_08082014.jpg

Kind regards,
Matej Mihelčič

w: astronomska-revija-spika.si
w: tejafabjan.org

Στις Παρ., 15/08/14, ο/η Matej Mihelčič matejmihelcic82@gmail.com [Comet-Images] έγραψε:

Θέμα: [Comet-Images] C/2014E2 Jacques
Προς: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Ημερομηνία: Παρασκευή, 15 Αύγουστος 2014, 1:31

Dear,

My color image of comet
Jacques made on 08.08.2014 at 1:15UT from small hill in
central part of Slovenia near capital city Ljubljana where
observing conditions of course are not ideal for faint sky
objects. Images taken with Gemini Telesope Design
G53F + GSO 20cm f4 + G2-8300 LRGB

http://astronomska-revija-spika.si/matej/C2014E2-JACQUES_08082014.jpg

Kind regards,
Matej
Mihelčič

w: astronomska-revija-spika.siw: tejafabjan.org

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-reco {
margin-bottom:20px;padding:0px;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-sponsor #yiv1713604729ov
li a {
font-size:130%;text-decoration:none;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-sponsor #yiv1713604729ov
li {
font-size:77%;list-style-type:square;padding:6px 0;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-sponsor #yiv1713604729ov
ul {
margin:0;padding:0 0 0 8px;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-text {
font-family:Georgia;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-text p {
margin:0 0 1em 0;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-text tt {
font-size:120%;}

#yiv1713604729 #yiv1713604729ygrp-vital ul li:last-child {
border-right:none !important;
}

----- Original Message -----
From: Matej Mihelčič matejmihelcic82@gmail.com [Comet-Images]
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 15, 2014 12:31 AM
Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2014E2 Jacques

Dear,

My color image of comet Jacques made on 08.08.2014 at 1:15UT from small hill in central part of Slovenia near capital city Ljubljana where observing conditions of course are not ideal for faint sky objects. Images taken with Gemini Telesope Design G53F + GSO 20cm f4 + G2-8300 LRGB

http://astronomska-revija-spika.si/matej/C2014E2-JACQUES_08082014.jpg

Kind regards,
Matej Mihelčič

w: astronomska-revija-spika.si
w: tejafabjan.org

Date:  Sat, 16 Aug 2014 00:29:25 -0700
From:  roger@rogergroom.com
Subject:  C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) images
Hi all,

I regularly capture images of the comet C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring). New images from last night are now up on my page. It is good to have the moon diminishing in brightness, allowing more of the comet to stand out again.

Usually my images consist of batches of 10x300s summed. Here is my webpage with images: Photographs of Comet C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) http://rogergroom.com/astro-photography/comet-photography/photographs-of-comet-c2013-a1-siding-spring/

http://rogergroom.com/astro-photography/comet-photography/photographs-of-comet-c2013-a1-siding-spring/

Photographs of Comet C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) http://rogergroom.com/astro-photography/comet-photography/photographs-of-comet-c2013-a1-siding-spring/ This page contains photographs of the comet C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) taken with my 12" SCT telescope from Perth, Western Australia in the southern hem...

View on rogergroom.com http://rogergroom.com/astro-photography/comet-photography/photographs-of-comet-c2013-a1-siding-spring/
Preview by Yahoo

Regards,
Roger.

Date:  Sat, 16 Aug 2014 20:45:21 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 E2 (Jacques) - Aug 16th.
Hi all.

Here is C/2014 E2 captured last night. Despite the near last quarter moon in the sky this didn't seem to cause to many problems. Some nice delicate streamers can be seen within the ion tail.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_e2_2014_08_16dp.jpg

15cm F6 with STL-11k. LRGB. L: 20mins. RGB: 3mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Question for group on comet guiding...
Greetings Comet friends,

My question - is there an auto guiding software like the PHD that I now use that will offset the guide star at periodic intervals to track moving comets? Maybe I am asking for the impossible. My AP1200 is a non robotic mount and you only have one speed.

Clear Skies,

Chris

Date:  Wed, 20 Aug 2014 21:23:48 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 E2 (Jacques) - Aug 20th.
Hi all,

Here is C/2014 E2 from Aug 20th. Alas this was all that was obtained between clouds - no colour data was possible.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_e2_2014_08_20dp.jpg

The nebulosity surrounding the comet is part of the Heart Nebula. Again fine streamers visible within the ion tail.

106mm F5 with STL-11k. L filter only. 16 mins exposure.

Best Wishes

Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Dear,

My another color image of comet Jacques made on 18.08.2014 at 21:35UT.

> Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2014E2 Jacques

>
> My color
> image of comet Jacques made on 08.08.2014 at 1:15UT from
> small hill in central part of Slovenia near capital city
> Ljubljana where observing conditions of course are not ideal
> for faint sky objects. Images taken with Gemini Telesope
> Design G53F + GSO 20cm f4 + G2-8300 LRGB
>
> http://astronomska-revija-spika.si/matej/C2014E2-JACQUES_08082014.jpg
>
> Kind
> regards,
> Matej
> Mihelčič
>
> w: astronomska-revija-spika.siw: tejafabjan.org
>

Date:  Wed, 20 Aug 2014 23:49:47 +0200
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  Comet Jacques encounter with IC 1848 and IC 1805
Hello everybody,

Under the guidance of friend Michael Jäger we found a place with clear sky
after a long drive. This is a rough processed b& w image of the encounter
of comet C/2014E2 Jacques with IC 1805 and IC 1848. Color will be processed
later:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/235_2014E2_1908.jpg

best regards

Gerald 

Date:  Thu, 21 Aug 2014 11:18:34 +0200
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  mosaic of the comet C/2014 E2 over 3 days
http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=100814&PHPSESSID=1arudhbgb06r31lcd7nb98adh6

Mosaic very difficult to balance, because in 3 days the sky was very variable. But
you notice the movement in the sky of this beautiful Comet :)

regards
Rolando Ligustri

C.A.R.A. http://cara.uai.it

Date: Wednesday, August 20, 2014, 1:23 PM

Hi
all,
Here
is C/2014 E2 from Aug 20th. Alas this was all that was
obtained between clouds - no colour data was
possible.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_e2_2014_08_20dp.jpg
The
nebulosity surrounding the comet is part of the Heart
Nebula. Again fine streamers visible within the ion
tail.
106mm
F5 with STL-11k. L filter only. 16 mins exposure.

Best
Wishes
Damian
 *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

background-position:center;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-color:white;border:1px
solid black;height:62px;width:62px;}

a,
#yiv1532200036 div.yiv1532200036photo-title a:active,

text-decoration:none;
}

div.yiv1532200036attach-row {
clear:both;}

div.yiv1532200036attach-row div {
float:left;}

clear:both;padding:15px 0 3px 0;overflow:hidden;}

Date:  Thu, 21 Aug 2014 22:18:16 +0200
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  comet C/2014 Q2 (LOVEJOY) - 20 aug.
New image of comet C/2014 Q2 (LOVEJOY) with 0.4-m f/6.8 remote telescope

(G39 observatory) ROAD - Remote Observatory Atacama Dessert, Chile by
Franz-Josef (Josch) Hambsch and Erik Bryssinck

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2014q2_20140820.html

Kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck and Franz-Josef (Josch) Hambsch

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 E2 (Jacques) - Aug 21st.
Very nice Damian, I love IC1795, its so very peculiar in appearance. The comet three gas tails are easily seen here too, good processing job on that.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Mon, 25 Aug 2014 10:44:37 +0200
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  image new comet C/2014 Q3 (BORISOV)
Hallo,

While this comet was still mentioned on the PCCP of minor planet center (as
object GB00010) , we did several observations of this object.

First observations by use of remote telescope from iTelescope.net

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2014q3_20140823_i89.html

second a observation in collaboration with Franz-Josef (Josch) Hambsch from
ROAD-observatory (Remote Observatory Atacama Desert, Chile)

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2014q3_20140823_g39.html

kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck & Franz-Josef (Josch) Hambsch

Belgium

Date:  Mon, 25 Aug 2014 16:10:15 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden with Rosette Nebula (Aug 24th.)
Hi all,

C/2013 V5 passed very close to the Rosette Nebula during the last few days making a nice opportunity to catch this famous nebula with a bright comet alongside.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_v5_2014_08_24dp.jpg

106mm F5. STL-11k. HaLRGB. 25mins total exposure.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Tue, 26 Aug 2014 19:41:07 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden close-up (Aug 25th.)
Hi all,

Here is my most recent image of C/2013 V5. Rather reminds me of ISON shortly before its outburst and subsequent disintegration.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_v5_2014_08_25dp.jpg

20" CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 14mins RGB: 2mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Tue, 26 Aug 2014 20:44:28 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden close-up (Aug 25th.)
Beautiful picture Damian! Yes indeed, I have to agree with you, the appearance is quite remanicent of ISON in many ways, especially the tapering dust tail. Date:  Wed, 27 Aug 2014 21:26:43 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Jacques Last night - surprising dust tail development 08-26-14
Greetings Comet Friends,

Finally an hour or two hole in the monsoon clouds over Arizona, and we set up the 80mm f/4.6 Zeiss APO and ST10xme for comet imaging. This set, which was 40m L channel data only is a quick post to highlight what we obtained. The star field in the 4 degree wide view was very dense, hiding all but the brightest tail details. The Cepheus milky way was realy bright here. Two versions are shown, one normal averaged stacked and the second using Median in maxim dL. I was shocked to see how well the not so pretty median shot showed the faint tails. While the ion tail is thin and wispy as expected, the broad dust tail pointing to the upper left was new to us. We are back to rain again tonight, and I will work on the color versions now. stay tuned...

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques082614.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Wed, 27 Aug 2014 21:57:42 -0700
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  2014 E2 and 2013 V5
Hello

From mountain location, clear and dark sky
8"/2.8 FLI 8300

2014 E2 4x180 sec 3x3 bin Aug. 27 UT 23.02

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140827ut2302s4x180_1409201211.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014e220140827ut2302s4x180_1409201211.jpg

2013 V5 4x180sec 2x2 bin 8-10° high Aug. 28 UT 2.25

Michael Jäger

Date:  Thu, 28 Aug 2014 20:28:14 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Color data added for 8/26 Comet Jacques images.
HI all,

Its always interesting to see what color data can do for comets. The starry background is not only dense with countless milky way stars, but they are quite colorful as well. As I mentioned before, the way to add a single set of RGB data to star trails when tracking comets is to duplicate the RGB data as layers over the L channel data, align all the star beads with a layer of RGB, change the combine to color. Then delete the L channel. Use this for your color for the comet image.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques082614.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Fri, 29 Aug 2014 14:04:10 +0200

Date:  Sat, 30 Aug 2014 11:08:11 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 E2: 26 Aug.  2014
Outstanding Gianluca! This is another example where median combine is the best method. There is so many stars in this part of the sky, there is no tail if you just stack by averaging or adding.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Sat, 30 Aug 2014 12:45:48 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Jacques - With DLSR and SV80s  Last night 8/29
Hi all,

A bit dissapointed on the lack of sensitivity and noise of a Hutech Modded DSLR, my canon XTi compared to my water cooled top of the line CCD. I couldnt even see the comet in the 80mm in a 1 second framing exposure! Such is the reason we all own a CCD.

Here they are anyway, the colors at least is not too bad, a nice emerald green color. Hope you like them:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques082914.html

BTW - tonight is the BIG night for Jacques - right over IC1396. Dont miss this one!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Sat, 30 Aug 2014 22:33:47 +0200

Gerald

Date:  Sun, 31 Aug 2014 16:22:50 -0700
From:  chergen@yahoo.com
Subject:  C/2013 A1,C/2013 V5,C/2014 Q1,C/2014 Q2 from Warrumbungle
A few images from the Warrumbungle 0.51-m through the Sierra Stars Observatory Network.

C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) at V = 9.7
http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7201 http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7201

C/2013 V5 (Oukaimeden) at V = 8.9 (though visually I've been estimating it at V ~ 7.7)
http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7218 http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7218

C/2014 Q1 (PANSTARRS) at V = 17.2
http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7205 http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7205

C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) at V = 15.0
http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7222 http://www.alpo-astronomy.org/gallery/main.php?g2_itemId=7222

These images are in the ALPO Comet Section Image Gallery. If you'd like to contribute to the Comet Section, just send your images to me.

Thanks,
- Carl Hergenrother
- Coordinator ALPO Comet Section

New observation : 11P Tempel-Swift-Linear.
In dRA : -4.5'and dDe : +1.5' its calculated position.
Last comment by station 360 => 2002 February 07.
Magnitude m2 : +/-20.7
Coma: +/- 9", no visible tail.
Radius opening measures : 4.8" for a sampling: 1.62"/pix.

4P Faye

Sincerely.
SOULIER Jean-François
C10/France
Date:  Mon, 01 Sep 2014 17:10:35 +0200

Date:  Fri, 05 Sep 2014 08:27:19 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet  17P/ Holmes, Comet  C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden
Greetings Cometary friends!

Got in some last minute early AM shooting yesterday, and would like to share them with you now. First, 15th magnitude comet Holmes, the former "exploding" comet, now in its quiescent state:

http://schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Holmes090314.html

Next, Comet Oukaimeden which is really starting to brighten up now, but is VERY low. for this set, I could only get 1/4 of my 12 inch Newtonian over the observatory wall to start the set, and probably only had less than half the aperture by the time twilight ended the sequence. None the less, a very nice comet!

http://schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/CometOukaimeden090314.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Sat, 06 Sep 2014 10:52:47 +0200
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  2012K 1 this morning from Namibia
Hello everyone,

Today morning after finished the imaging session of 2013 V5 I moved the
scope to 2012 K1. Altitude was very law and dawn was already very bright.
Finally I got an LRGB set of images with very short expose time but look
what one can already see on this 3 minute luminance image:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/239_2012K1_0609bw.jpg

the inverted view:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/240_2012K1_0609bw_inv.jpg

looks promising!

Gerald

Date:  Sun, 07 Sep 2014 21:56:22 +0200
From:  Alfons Diepvens 
Subject:  C23 -NEW images: Nucleus split of C2011 J2 LINEAR


** Nucleus split of C2011 J2 LINEAR
Images of b component :

- 02 Sept. 2014
C2011 J2 LINEAR - b component ( 21h 00m UT )
C2011 J2 LINEAR - b component ( 23h 19m UT )

- 03 Sept. 2014
C2011 J2 LINEAR - b component ( 21h 09m UT )

with a direct link to the image:
http://www.astronomie.be/alfons.diepvens/cometimages/index.html

Alfons Diepvens 
Date:  Mon, 08 Sep 2014 09:50:48 +0200
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  2013 V5 September 6
Hello everybody,

This is the image of comet 2013V5 taken on Sept 6 :

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/242_2013V5_0609.jpg

best regards

Gerald 

Date:  Mon, 08 Sep 2014 05:21:05 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2013 V5 September 6
Gerald, superior image - the southerly location of your telescope really makes quite a difference! We can see it only 15 degrees up at twilight here in Arizona right now, not enough for a really clear shot.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

On Mon, 9/15/14, Michael Oates me@mikeoates.org [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 E2 (Jacques) in Cygnus
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, September 15, 2014, 3:47 PM

Hi,

I have just processed and uploaded an image of C/2014 E2
(Jacques) as it passed through
Cygnus on the 7th Sept 2014.

Image: http://astrob.in/full/121058/0/
Details: http://astrob.in/121058/0/

Mike

------------------------------------
Posted by: Michael Oates

Date:  Tue, 16 Sep 2014 20:54:11 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet Oukaimeden (Sep 14th.)
Hi all.

Here is another image of C/2013 V5, this from the 14th and taken during morning twilight. This will be my last image of it until it hopefully reappears following perihelion.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_v5_2014_09_14dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. L filter. 16mins exposure.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Tue, 16 Sep 2014 13:03:49 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet Oukaimeden (Sep 14th.)
Damian, that is one amazing shot. I tried in vain this week to image it, but it was below the walls of my observatory and the trees too! Unfortunately, when it emerges in the evening sky it will be 14th magnitude I thinks. The good news is on the 20th, Comet siding springs will be in Ara, just above our horizon here in Arizona.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Date:  Tue, 16 Sep 2014 20:33:42 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Jacques has lost its tail!  9/14/14
Greetings comet Friends,

Before the current big monsoon storm hit Arizona, I was able to get an hour on this comet as it passed Alberio in Cygnus. The star background was very dense here, and the comet is now trending blues rather than greens as the dominant color in the RGB set. So its Teal Colored. ;)

Thanks for looking:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques091414.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Wed, 17 Sep 2014 19:53:23 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2012 K1 (Sep 16th.)
Hi all,

Here is C/2012 K1 PanSTARRS now reappearing in the dawn sky. This was obtained during morning twilight.

A distinct dust and ion tail are present almost opposite each other in PA. Some nice wavy ion tail streamers.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2012_k1_2014_09_16dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. L filter. 10mins exposure.

Best Wishes

Damian

Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk

Date:  Fri, 19 Sep 2014 20:08:13 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Sidings Springs dress rehearsal...
Greetings comet friends,

In the next few days this comet will for the first time be viewable from the southern USA as it races northwards to its meeting with Mars next month. Tonight I went out with binoculars and Tirion in hand and was able to see alpha Ara about a degree up at 7:50. That's -50 dec but is tough because it is in the south west and no longer on the meridian. I'll let you know if I can find it in the comming few days!

Chris Schur

Date:  Sun, 21 Sep 2014 13:23:21 +1000
From:  Michael Mattiazzo 
Subject:  visual comet observations 2014 September 20
Hello all,

find below my visual comet observations on 2014 September 20

I have also posted images of Oukaimeden and Jacques on my website.
http://members.westnet.com.au/mmatti/sc.htm

Tycho 2 VT mag comparison stars.

Comet C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden
2014 Sep 20.40 UT: m1=6.7, Dia.=4', DC=5/6...tail=25' in PA178...25x100mm
B...Michael Mattiazzo (Swan Hill, Victoria)
[Comet altitude 7 degrees. Morris method. In a 20cm reflector, faint
starlike nucleus of approximate magnitude 12, surrounded by a moderately
condensed coma.
Tail is slightly more pronounced on its eastern border.]

Comet C/2014 E2 Jacques
2014 Sep 20.42 UT: m1=8.7, Dia.=4', DC=5/6...25x100mm B...Michael Mattiazzo
(Swan Hill, Victoria)

Comet C/203A1 Siding Spring
2014 Sep 20.43 UT: m1=10.1, Dia.=3', DC=4...25x100mm B...Michael Mattiazzo
(Swan Hill, Victoria)
[in a crowded star field, may have affected estimate]

cheers,
Michael

Marting - great catch, looks like two disconnection events in progress here?
Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Mon, 22 Sep 2014 05:24:57 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2012 K1 Sep 21
Micheal, the images I have seen so far are spectacular, even in just 5 minutes you can record the galactic cirrus, and dark nebula glowing in the dark. What a perfect comet instrument - the one we have been waiting for. ;) They cost around $3500, same as what I paid for my 8 inch schmidt years ago.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Mon, 22 Sep 2014 14:31:06 +0200
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  C2012K1 Sept 19 and 20
Hello everbody,

I had the opportunity to image the comet several times. I find that the ion
tail is active but much weaker as expected after my first images from
September 6.

Anyway here are the first two of a set of four:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/243_2012K1_1909.jpg

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/244_2012K1_2009.jpg

best regards

Gerald

Date:  Thu, 25 Sep 2014 22:40:06 +1000
From:  Michael Mattiazzo 
Subject:  C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden on 2014 September 25 at 09:45UT
Hi All,

C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden on 2014 September 25 at 09:45UT
Visual estimate m1=7.2, Dia=3'. DC=5, tail 30' in PA144, 25x100mm
binoculars.
I have posted a photo on my website:
6x30sec exposure. Canon 60Da and Sigma 70-200mm f2.8 lens
Cropped. Image size is 3 degrees wide.
Galaxies M83 and NGC5253 near the tail are visible.

http://members.westnet.com.au/mmatti/sc.htm

cheers,
Michael Mattiazzo
Swan Hill, Victoria 

Date:  Thu, 25 Sep 2014 16:32:41 +0000
From:  jean-gabriel bosch 
Subject:  108P, 17P, 110P 2014-09-24
Hi,
Remote T400 SpaceObs A. Maury,
108P
17P
110P
Best regards,JG Bosch 
Date:  Thu, 25 Sep 2014 20:33:17 +0200
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2011 J2 Linear splitting: evolution of the fragment
Dear All,

Please find at the address below the latest observations of this comet performed
via the Virtual Telescope robotic facility in Italy:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/09/25/comet-c2011-j2-linear-splitting-image-24-sept-2014/

An animation there is showing at the fragment b separated from the main nucleus
in 11 days.

Best
Gianluca Masi 

Date:  Fri, 26 Sep 2014 09:48:29 +1000
From:  Alan Watson 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden on 2014 September 25 at 09:45UT
Another great image Michael.
Gas/ion Tail dynamics were evident in Stereo hi1b imager across 20140921.
So, some stretched L only images may catch this from the ground.
I'll be trying for this comet again when the clouds move on.
Rgds, Alan.

Thanks Alan,

Are you able to see whether STEREO observed the brief outburst event on Sep 12, detected by an earthbased telescope (FRAM), and could it have been related to a CME hit?
I seem to recall strong solar activity on this date.
Have you seen the brightness of other comets affected by CME's?

Date:  Fri, 26 Sep 2014 08:53:46 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  32P(Comas-Sola)  2014/09/25
Hello here is the periodic comet 32P (Comas-Sola) during its return in 2014.
Discovered in 1926 by the spanish astronomer Josep Comas i Sola.
Ιt inspired the famous group Tangerin Dream to compose the song "the Fly and Collision of Comas Sola".

A faint tail is visible. A photometry on the core using V mags on an L image showed 15.6mag.
The bright star in the center is HD73396 (8.33 mag)

full res here:

http://www.hellas-astro.gr/sites/default/files/images/observations/comets/2014-09-25-12-23-00_1838.jpg

manos
Date:  Fri, 26 Sep 2014 09:02:47 +0100
From:  Gustavo Muler

image comet attached.

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/images/2013a1_20140926_mpm.jpg

Martin

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/Comets.html

From:  Michael Mattiazzo 
Subject:  C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden image 2014 September 26
Hi all,

I have uploaded the following image to spaceweather.
C/2013 V5 Oukaimeden
2014 September 26 at 09:00UT
6x30sec exposure. I-telescope T17 0.43-m f/6.8 astrograph + CCD
Image size is 15 arcminutes high. North below.
Digital development to reveal detail in nucleus

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=102276

Date:  Sat, 27 Sep 2014 02:46:38 +0200
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2014-09-26  170P  305P  C/2011J2+b  P/2014M4
Hello
4 comets observed tonight

C/2011J2+b LINEAR, the fragment is very well visible, and moving away
from the nucleus
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2011J2_LINEAR.html

P/2014 M4 PANSTARRS, faint and quite far (>1') from the calculated position
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/P2014M4_PANSTARRS.html

170P/Christensen
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/170P_Christensen.html

305P/Skiff tail 60'' in PA 96
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/305P_Skiff.html

Best
Luc

Date:  Sat, 27 Sep 2014 13:52:47 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  4P  2014/09/25
Hello here is the periodic comet 4P (Faye) during its return in 2014 and almost 4 months after perihelion.

A fine tail is visible. A photometry on the core using V mags on an L image showed 14.9mag.
The bright star near the top is TYC 801-3-1 (9.63 mag)

full res here:

http://www.hellas-astro.gr/sites/default/files/images/observations/comets/2014-09-25-12-26-30_1839.jpg

  manos

Date:  Sun, 28 Sep 2014 21:21:02 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Finally - Comet Siding Springs C/2013 A1 From Arizona!
Greetings Comet Friends,

The Arizona monsoon has been cruel this year, and finally a clear night to try to image this faint comet. It is only 5 degrees or so up in the southwest for us above the pine forest treeline. Seeing was as you might expect poor, and I couldnt see the comet visually with the 80mm at all. Its pretty faint! I shot it up on a 14 foot tall balcony to get over some of the trees, with the mount and scope set up with a DLSR in one corner looking at a tiny piece of the western sky. So without any more delay:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/SS092814.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Tue, 30 Sep 2014 05:39:50 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Panstarrs K1 9/29/14 - Oh so low!
Greetings Cometary Friends,

The comet was only high enough to get about half the aperture on it over the observatory wall at the start of morning twilight. But still, even despite getting only half the images to come out from passing monsoon clouds, the results came out quite well. I was impressed with the strong yellow coloration of the dust tail and the delicate blue tint of the almost not there blue gas tail. Thanks for looking!

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsK1-092914a.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Tue, 30 Sep 2014 15:16:58 +0200
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2011 J2 Linear splitting: evolution of the fragment, updates
Dear All,

Please find at the address below the latest observations of this comet performed
via the Virtual Telescope robotic facility in Italy:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/09/30/comet-c2011-j2-linear-splitting-image-29-sept-2014-evolution/

An animation there is showing as the fragment b separated from the main nucleus
in 16 days.

Best
Gianluca Masi

Date:  Thu, 02 Oct 2014 23:10:16 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Milkyway & Zodiacal light on Oct 1st.
Hi all,

I have just recently returned from the Starmus Festival on Tenerife. I was able to spend some nights at the Observatorio del Teide (elev 2380m) an extremely dark and transparent location.

Here is a wide angle view showing the Milkyway and Zodiacal light meeting toward dawn with Jupiter prominent. The display was superb and could be seen visually stretching to near the zenith.

http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/zodiacal_night03.jpg

Canon 60Da with 8mm f3.5 fisheye. 2 x 3mins at ISO1600.

Best Wishes

Damian

View on www.damianpeach.com Preview by Yahoo

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************
Date:  Fri, 03 Oct 2014 06:12:30 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Milkyway & Zodiacal light on Oct 1st.
A great inspirational shot Damian!

manos

Ημερομηνία: Παρασκευή, 3 Οκτώβριος 2014, 1:10

Hi
all,
I
have just recently returned from the Starmus Festival on
Tenerife. I was able to spend some nights at the
Observatorio del Teide (elev 2380m) an extremely dark and
transparent location.

Here
is a wide angle view showing the Milkyway and Zodiacal light
meeting toward dawn with Jupiter prominent. The display was
superb and could be seen visually stretching to near the
zenith.

http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/zodiacal_night03.jpg
Canon
60Da with 8mm f3.5 fisheye. 2 x 3mins at ISO1600.
Best
Wishes
Damian

on www.damianpeach.comPreview

Date:  Sun, 05 Oct 2014 16:32:30 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Gegenschein on Oct 1st.
Hi all,

Further to my shot of the Zodiacal light with Milkyway, earlier this night the Gegenschein was also photographed. Conditions on this night were near perfect with zero clouds and very low humidity.

Gegenschein: http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/gegenschein_teide.jpg

Zodiacal light: http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/zodiacal_night03.jpg

Canon 60Da with Sigma 8mm F3.5. ISO 1600. 2x3mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date: Thursday, October 2, 2014, 3:10 PM

Hi
all,
I
have just recently returned from the Starmus Festival on
Tenerife. I was able to spend some nights at the
Observatorio del Teide (elev 2380m) an extremely dark and
transparent location.

Here
is a wide angle view showing the Milkyway and Zodiacal light
meeting toward dawn with Jupiter prominent. The display was
superb and could be seen visually stretching to near the
zenith.

http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/zodiacal_night03.jpg
Canon
60Da with 8mm f3.5 fisheye. 2 x 3mins at ISO1600.
Best
Wishes
Damian

Date:  Tue, 07 Oct 2014 20:16:40 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Orion from Teide Observatory (Sep 29th.)
Hi all,

Here is a widefield image of Orion taken on my first night at the Teide Observatory on Sep 29th. This was taken with pretty basic equipment and certainly a testament to the sky quality there.

http://www.damianpeach.com/starmus14/orion_night01.jpg

Canon 60Da on Astrotrac. 10 x 2mins at ISO1600. 18-55mm lens with Hoya diffuser.

Special thanks to Ian Sharp for the loan of his Astrotrac.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Thu, 09 Oct 2014 17:26:24 +0200
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2011 J2 Linear splitting: updates
Dear All,

Despite the extremely bright Moon, we managed to observe this comet and its
fragment b again:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/10/09/comet-c2011-j2-linear-splitting-image-6-oct-2014-animation/

An animation there is showing how the fragment b separated from the main nucleus.

Best
Gianluca Masi

Date:  Sun, 12 Oct 2014 17:27:24 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet Siding Spring (Oct 11th.)
Hi all,

Here is C/2013 A1 captured yesterday. A nice faint and wide curving dust tail can be seen. Now just one week from its close approach of Mars.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_a1_2014_10_11dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins RGB: 3mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Date:  Thu, 16 Oct 2014 19:49:07 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet Siding Spring (October 16th.)
Hi all,

Here is C/2013 A1 now just three days from its Martian encounter. Presently moving against the dense star clouds of the southern Milkyway.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_a1_2014_10_16dp.jpg

17"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Fri, 17 Oct 2014 20:35:44 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet Siding Spring (October 17th.)
Hi all,

Here is C/2013 A1 with two days to go until its Martian encounter. Very dense Milkyway starfield in the background with many darker obscured regions.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_a1_2014_10_17dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.

Date:  Sat, 18 Oct 2014 16:38:50 +0200
From:  chrismlt@laposte.net
Subject:  Comet "A1" and Mars

Dear all,

Last evening (oct-17) the sky was almost perfect after a couple of weeks of bad weather.
I managed to image the celestial wedding of the year with a cheap lens and the FS102 refractor.
The duo was very low between 18h38 and 19h10 Ut when imaging (7 to 3.5 deg above the horizon, and airmass from 7.4 to 13.7), and the Rhone valley is quite bright at night, especially to the south, but the comet really stands near Mars !
Photometry : m1=12.37 with the 110 mm lense, and 14.17 with the FS102 (radius 11'', no filter) ; quite in adequacy with other measures, surprisignly, despite the low altitude of those people.

images and details are visible here :
https://www.flickr.com/photos/93826649@N04/

Cheers,
Christophe
Date:  Sat, 18 Oct 2014 18:12:48 +0200

13.81UT

Subject:  PANSTARRS C2012 K1
Hi,

Comet PANSTARRS C2012 K1 this morning in Puppis. Nine minutes total exposure through an 8” f4 Newt with a 58x77 arc minute field of view of this active comet that has been putting on a show since April.

From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2012 K1 on October 17th.
Hi all,

Here is C/2012 K1 on October 17th. No ion tail was seen.....

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2012_k1_2014_10_17dp.jpg

20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.

Date:  Thu, 23 Oct 2014 20:28:13 +0100
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  32P/Comas Sola (October 23rd.)
Hi all.

Here is an image of periodic comet 32P/Comas Sola from Oct 23rd. Having recently passed through perihelion though still glowing rather dimly at 13th mag. A faint narrow dust tail is apparent.

http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/32p_2014_10_23dp2.jpg

17"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Fri, 24 Oct 2014 10:50:31 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  Comet 201P, 2014/10/22
Hello, here is an image of 201P with a very nice tail. The magnitude m2 measured from L image and Vmag comparison stars is 15.7. There is something like an extension South of the coma but there is a star also there. The bright galaxy is the 15.4mag PGC68619.
full res here:

http://www.hellas-astro.gr/sites/default/files/images/observations/comets/2014-10-22-11-24-34_1851.jpg

Manos Kardasis
http://kardasis.weebly.com/

Date:  Tue, 28 Oct 2014 19:42:20 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q3 Borisov on Oct. 25
At the end of October, 2014 comet C/2014 Q3 Borisov had a sudden increase of brightness, increasing from 14 to 11 magnitude, approximately. In this image I took on October 25 the comet shows a central condensation fairly bright and surrounded by a gassy coma of 7' wide:
http://cometografia.es/2014/10/2014q3-borisov-25oct2014/

Regards.

José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Sun, 02 Nov 2014 13:46:07 +0100
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  image comet C/2013 A1 (SIDING SPRING) 2 nov.2014
Image and data of comet C/2013 A1 (SIDING SPRING) - Af(ro) parameter
according the CARA-approach reveals an important increase ! see data and
image via link below:

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2013a1_20141102.html

___________________________________

kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck & Franz-Josef Hambsch

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/

From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 N3 (NEOWISE) - Nov 1st.
Hi all,

Here is an image of faint comet C/2014 N3. A short dust tail is visible.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_n3_2014_11_01dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.

Best Wishes

Damian

Date:  Thu, 06 Nov 2014 20:23:15 +0100
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  comet C/2013 A1 on nov 4th and 6th
observations of 4 + 6 nov of comet C/2013 A1 (SIDING SPRING) - we can see an
increase of the Af(rho) parameter of this comet from about 550 cm until
today 1865 cm for an aperture of 10.000km with I-Bessel broadbandfilter

observations on nov 4th

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2013a1_20141104.html

observations on nov 6th

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2013a1_20141106.html

observations in the past:

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2013a1.html

___________________________________

kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck & Franz-Josef Hambsch (Belgium)

Date:  Tue, 11 Nov 2014 03:02:13 -0800
From:  d_steinberg@hotmail.com
Subject:  HISTORIC COMET LANDING TOMORROW
From http://www.spaceweather.com/ http://www.spaceweather.com/

HISTORIC COMET LANDING TOMORROW: The European Space Agency is about to make history: On Nov. 12th, it is going to land on a comet. The action begins Wednesday at 08:35 UT when ESA's Rosetta spacecraft http://sci.esa.int/rosetta/ drops a probe named "Philae" onto the core of Comet 67P. This video shows what happens next:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=szKZ77MbF9Q

In the past, nations of Earth have landed on planets, moons, and asteroids, but never before on a comet. This is an important and daring first. "A comet is unlike any other planetary body that we've attempted to land on," says Claudia Alexander of the US Rosetta Project at JPL. "Getting Philae down successfully will be an incredible achievement for humankind."

"How hard is this landing?" asks Art Chmielewski, the US Rosetta Project Manager. "Consider this: The comet will be moving 40 times faster than a speeding bullet, spinning, shooting out gas and welcoming Rosetta on the surface with boulders, cracks, scarps and possibly meters of dust!"

Philae will take 7 hours to fall 22.5 km from the spacecraft to the comet--an interval some mission scientists are calling "The Seven Hours of Terror." Confirmation of the landing will reach ground stations on Wednesday at approximately 1600 UT. You can follow the descent as it happens by tuning in to ESA's #CometLanding webcast.

Date:  Sun, 16 Nov 2014 21:55:08 +0100
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2014-11-15&16   201P C2013US10 C2013V4 C2014Q1
Dear all

Date:  Mon, 24 Nov 2014 09:32:35 +1100
From:  Alan Watson 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014 Q3 Nov. 21
This comet is looking good for southern imagers as it approaches the zenith
near my location in Melbourne,Australia.
Here is my first attempt at it when low 20Alt from my back yard. Hoping for
a long dynamic tail on this one soon...

one-fadinganother-rising.html


kind regards, Alan.

Date:  Mon, 24 Nov 2014 21:58:08 +1100
From:  mmatti@westnet.com.au
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014 Q3 Nov. 21
Hi Alan,
Michael Jäger’s image is of C/2013 Q3 Borisov, only visible in the northern hemisphere.
It looks quite bright, mag 10 or brighter. Fantastic image as usual.
You are referring to C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy, which is brightening rapidly
and should be a great target in the next couple of months from both hemispheres,
Cheers,
Michael Mattiazzo

Subject:  Comet C/2012 K1 Panstarrs - Nov 22nd.
Hi all,
Here is C/2012 K1 captured on Nov 22nd. A very narrow ion tail can be seen.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2012_k1_2014_11_22dp.jpg
17"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 14mins. RGB: 2mins.

Date:  Thu, 27 Nov 2014 20:45:40 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) - Nov 26th.
Hi all,
Here is C/2013 US10 from yesterday. This time next year this will hopefully be a naked eye object. For the moment its 14th magnitude and still 4.8AU away from us. None the less its sporting an interesting teardrop like appearance. No appreciable colour is visible.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_us10_2014_11_26dp.jpg
27"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.
Best Wishes
Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
************************************************* 

Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 10:29:10 +0100
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  2014Q2 Lovejoy
Hello everybody,

This is my first shot of this comet. I had a lot of problems with the
focuser but finally I was lucky to obtain an image set which was not perfect
but adequate:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/253_2014Q2_28_11.jpg

best regards

Gerald

Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 16:59:50 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on Nov.26
http://cometografia.es/2014/11/2014q2-lovejoy-26nov2014/
Image of comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) taken on November 26, 2014. Although be to two months of its perihelion already has increased brightness until 8 magnitude, showing a powerful coma of C2 gas with 10' diameter, and a weak ionic tail barely visible in the image toward northwest.
Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector + FLI PL09000 camera (L:1×120 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)Remotely from Siding Spring, Australia.
Regards.

José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 
Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 17:49:25 +0100
From:  Stefan Beck 
Subject:  Image gallery of the German Comet section reaches number 10.000
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hi,

I'm the maintainer of the image gallery of the German comet section.

The gallery contains almost 10.000 images from observers from all over
the world.

I invite every comet photographer/observer to upload
images/videos/sketches to the archive at
http://kometen.fg-vds.de/pix/test/up2_e.php

You can browse the images at http://kometen.fg-vds.de/bildere.htm

Old images are welcomed too.

- --
Best regards,

Stefan Beck

"Image processing for Comets"
http://www.cometchaser.de/imageprocessingcomets.html

"All comet observers of the world"
http://www.cometchaser.de/observers/names.html

"Google map of known comet observers:"
http://www.cometchaser.de/observers/map.html

http://www.cometchaser.de
"Astrophotography with small telescopes"

http://www.cometchaser.de/d_index.html
"Astrophotography with small telescopes auf Deutsch"

Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 17:40:18 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) - Nov 26th.
Hi all,
Here is a recent image of C/2014 Q2. Coming along very nicely with a faint but delicate ion tail showing various streamers. I was especially struck by how intensely green coloured the coma is in the RGB frames (The G frame showing a large diffuse coma compared to the other filters.)
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q2_2014_11_26dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.
Best Wishes
Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
************************************************* 

Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 10:21:27 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q3 Borisov last night
Greetings cometary friends. Quite a faint one as our brightest northerly comet. The nice short fan tail and slightly teal coma are a bonus! These images look great on my CRT with 16 million colors, but seen quite chunky on my new laptop screen with its LCD.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/BorisovQ3-112814.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Fri, 28 Nov 2014 10:30:21 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) - Nov 26th.
Damian, outstanding results! Why do the souther guys get all the good comets? ;)

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Hi
all,
Here is a
recent image of C/2014 Q2. Coming along very nicely with a
faint but delicate ion tail showing various streamers. I was
especially struck by how intensely green coloured the coma
is in the RGB frames (The G frame showing a large diffuse
coma compared to the other filters.)
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q2_2014_11_26dp.jpg
20"CDK
with FLI camera. LRGB. L: 15mins. RGB: 2mins.
Best
Wishes
Damian

Date:  Fri, 12 Dec 2014 18:50:04 -0800
From:  jnassr2010@yahoo.com
Subject:  C2014 Q2
Hi,

Comet Lovejoy C/2014 Q2 last night in Puppis through an 8” f2.8 Newtonian. The field of view is 80 x 106 arc minutes. The comet is just barely visible through 10x50 binoculars.

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec122014N8f28683LRGB8444x2min3x3_20141212204522.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec122014N8f28683LRGB8444x2min3x3_20141212204522.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec122014N8f28683LRGB8444x2min3x3_20141212204522.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC20... http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec122014N8f28683LRGB8444x2min3x3_20141212204522.jpg

View on stardustobservatory.org http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec122014N8f28683LRGB8444x2min3x3_20141212204522.jpg

Date: Friday, December 12, 2014, 9:50 AM

http://www.astrobin.com/140447/

today the ion tail it's long about 2°

regards
Rolando Ligustri

Date:  Sun, 14 Dec 2014 21:43:15 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Broom star Lovejoy - Dec 14th.
Hi all,
Here is another image of Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy.) This one really shows the delicate tail streamers clearly. I also see reports it has been seen visually with the naked eye.
It rather reminds me of ISONs outburst appearance with its broad ion tail of streamers though isn't quite as bright and dramatic. None the less it nicely fits the description of a "broom star."
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q2_2014_12_14dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB image.
Best Wishes
Damian
 *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

all,
Here is
another image of Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy.) This one really
shows the delicate tail streamers clearly. I also see
reports it has been seen visually with the naked
eye.
It rather
reminds me of ISONs outburst appearance with its broad ion
tail of streamers though isn't quite as bright and
dramatic. None the less it nicely fits the description of a
"broom star."
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q2_2014_12_14dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB image.

Hello everybody,

Here are two quickly processed images from last night. One is a mosaic of
two frames. Tail structures are changing extremely fast thus I could only
use one frame of each LRGB. If I find the time I will produce a video which
will show you the tails activity.

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/255_2014Q2_14_12.jpg

An: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: Re: [Comet-Images] Comet 2014Q2 Dec 14

Gerald, I like both shots tremendously, the second shot is more exciting because it shows more tail, but crops the coma a bit.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

On Mon, 12/15/14, 'Gerald Rhemann' gerald.rhemann@gmail.com [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet 2014Q2 Dec 14
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, December 15, 2014, 7:21 AM

Hello everybody, Here are
two quickly processed images from last night. One is a
mosaic of two frames. Tail structures are changing extremely
fast thus I could only use one frame of each LRGB. If I find
the time I will produce a video which will show you the
tails activity.
http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/255_2014Q2_14_12.jpg
http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/256_2014Q2_14_12_2.jpg
best regards
Gerald

Date:  Wed, 17 Dec 2014 10:37:57 +0100
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2014-12-16 C2011J2 C2014W2 P2014X1
Dear all
3 comets observed yesterday evening

C/2011 J2 only 900s exposure, comet near a star, fragments B or C not
detected with such a short exposure
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2011J2_LINEAR.html

C/2014 W2, close to a star too
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2014W2_PANSTARRS.html

P/2014 X1 Elenin
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/P2014X1_Elenin.html

Best

Luc

Date:  Wed, 17 Dec 2014 19:07:45 -0800
From:  jnassr2010@yahoo.com
Subject:  C2014 Q2
This eleven minute exposure was through a 16” scope and a KAF8300 chip. Distinct streamers emanate from the nucleus.

Date:  Fri, 19 Dec 2014 11:12:29 +1300
From:  john_drummond@xtra.co.nz
Subject:  Re: [CometObs] C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) Visual Obs - Photo
Oops, forgot to add that I took some photos - 13cm f3.3 Takahashi Epsilon Newtonian + Canon 500D DSLR. 60 x 1-3 minute @ 1600 iso. FOV = 3 x 2 degrees. I’m having website issues so the image isn’t on my webpage but it is on the Spaceweather.com gallery -

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=105404

Regards
John D

From: mailto:CometObs-noreply@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, December 19, 2014 10:51 AM
To: CometObs@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [CometObs] C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) Visual Obs

Hi,

I observed C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) visually last night. I believe that I can just see it naked eye. It was near the zenith with a dark rural sky (Sky Quality Meter = 21.41, LM ~mag 6.6).

2014 Dec. 18.50 UT: m1=6.2, Dia.=12’, DC=5, Tail=30’ in PA of 347, NE and 11x80B, John Drummond, (Gisborne, New Zealand).

Regards
==============================
John Drummond, Possum Observatory, IAU Code E94, Gisborne, New Zealand (177d 53' E, 38d 38' S)
Vote Drummond for 2016 Gisborne District Council - Drummond: Striving to maintain Gisborne's unique beauty & enjoy its natural resources...
Royal Astronomical Society of New Zealand vice president - www.rasnz.org.nz
Gisborne Astronomical Society president - www.astrogas.co.nz

Email: john_drummond@xtra.co.nz
Website: www.possumobservatory.co.nz
Images: http://www.possumobservatory.co.nz/latest_images-all-continuing.htm
Phone (mobile): 0275 609 287

Date:  Thu, 18 Dec 2014 23:29:31 -0500
From:  "Paul A. Valleli" 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Lovejoy's tail
John,
I am surprised that your image shows no evidence of coma at F/2.8. Are you using a coma corrector ?
Starman Paul

Date:  Fri, 19 Dec 2014 07:26:32 +0000
From:  John Nassr 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Lovejoy's tail
Starman Paul,
I use a Newtonian reducer/corrector by Philip Keller.
John

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec182014N8f28683L2x5minRGB2x3min2x2_20141218200805.jpg

John

Date:  Fri, 19 Dec 2014 20:54:59 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 15P/Finlay - December 19th.
Hi all,
Here is 15P captured today following its outburst. Some nice jets present within the coma.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/15p_2014_12_19dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. Unfiltered image.
Best Wishes
Damian
 *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

From:  John Nassr 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet 15P/Finlay - December 19th.

Fascinating capture! I guess we all love comets because they rapidly change and are often full of surprises.
Best regards,
John

#yiv6810606734ygrp-text tt {font-size:120%;}#yiv6810606734 #yiv6810606734ygrp-vital ul li:last-child {border-right:none !important;}#yiv6810606734

Date:  Sat, 20 Dec 2014 02:54:28 +0000
From:  John Nassr 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet 15P/Finlay - December 19th.
Damian,
......and the time to acquire date does not require tedious hours, or even several nights to get a decent image as with deep sky objects! But they are no less engaging. I often catch myself during the day while at work or with friends thinking about the next comet image in terms of focal length, focal ratios, how fast the comet is moving, L time, RGB time, and whether or how much to bin exposures. Sometimes I think it becomes a bit too obsessive. But someone said, "All roads lead nowhere. What matters is that the road traveled is with heart." Its an uncommon fascination not shared by many, but most likely by all in this Group.

John

On Saturday, December 20, 2014 10:38 AM, "Damian Peach dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk [Comet-Images]" wrote:

FSQ106 with STL-11k camera. LRGB image.
Best Wishes
Damian

FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro

http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image4PFayeChile.htm

C 2014 R1 Borisov
Coma : +/- 2.15', Tail : +/- 8.10'
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2014R1BorisovChile.htm

C 2014 Q2 Lovejoy, I Bessel, + Afrho
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2014Q2LovejoyChile.htm

C 2014 W11 Panstarrs
Coma : +/- 13", Tail : +/- 39"
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2014W11PanstarrsChile.htm

C 2006 S3 Loneos, 8.74UA Earth Distance
Coma : +/- 43", Tail : +/- 3.30'
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2006S3LoneosChile.htm

15P Finlay, background noise to Mars 35' of the field.
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image15PFinlayChile.htm

108P Ciffreo, structure in the coma ?
Dim. : +/- 1'x 1.25'
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image108PCiffreoChile.htm

s/259_2014Q2_21_12.jpg>
http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/259_2014Q2_21_12.jpg

Wish you a Merry Christmas

Gerald

Date:  Tue, 23 Dec 2014 09:22:58 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona
Greetings Cometary Friends,

Finally, the first clear night during dark of the moon in over 3 months. This comet was about 15 degrees up and while the transparency was good (I live at 5150 feet elevation) the seeing was pretty bad. This comet has excellent coloration, and we are really looking forward to getting another set on this one. The image:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122214.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Tue, 23 Dec 2014 18:54:05 +0100
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona
Chris great shot, many "jets" are visible :)

I would have more saturated the colors, it seems to me that you have so much signal

regards
Rolando

From: "Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"
To: Comet Group
Sent: Tuesday, 23 December 2014, 17:22
Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona

  Greetings Cometary Friends,

Finally, the first clear night during dark of the moon in over 3 months. This comet was about 15 degrees up and while the transparency was good (I live at 5150 feet elevation) the seeing was pretty bad. This comet has excellent coloration, and we are really looking forward to getting another set on this one. The image:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122214.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

From: "Chris Schur
comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"


To: Comet
Group

Sent: Tuesday,
23 December 2014, 17:22
Subject: [Comet-Images]
Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona

Greetings
Cometary Friends,

Finally, the first clear night during dark of the moon in
over 3 months. This comet was about 15 degrees up and while
the transparency was good (I live at 5150 feet elevation)
the seeing was pretty bad. This comet has excellent
coloration, and we are really looking forward to getting
another set on this one. The image:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122214.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal:
http://www.schursastrophotography.com

#yiv1769091236 input, #yiv1769091236 textarea {
font:99% Arial, Helvetica, clean, sans-serif;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-mlmsg pre, #yiv1769091236
code {
font:115% monospace;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-mlmsg * {
line-height:1.22em;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-mlmsg #yiv1769091236logo
{
padding-bottom:10px;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-msg p a {
font-family:Verdana;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-msg
p#yiv1769091236attach-count span {
color:#1E66AE;font-weight:700;}

#yiv1769091236 #yiv1769091236ygrp-reco
#yiv1769091236reco-head {
color:#ff7900;font-weight:700;}

margin-bottom:20px;padding:0px;}

font-size:130%;text-decoration:none;}

Date:  Wed, 24 Dec 2014 17:52:01 +1100
From:  mmatti@westnet.com.au
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona
Rolando,
correct terminology is “streamers” for ion tail activity.
“jets” for dust activity.
ciao
Michael Mattiazzo

From: mailto:Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 24, 2014 4:54 AM
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona

Chris great shot, many "jets" are visible :)

I would have more saturated the colors, it seems to me that you have so much signal

regards
Rolando

From: "Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"

Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy from Arizona

> Greetings Cometary Friends,
>
> Finally, the first clear night during dark of the moon in over 3 months. This
> comet was about 15 degrees up and while the transparency was good (I live at 5150
> feet elevation) the seeing was pretty bad. This comet has excellent coloration,
> and we are really looking forward to getting another set on this one. The image:
>
> http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122214.html

Date:  Wed, 24 Dec 2014 08:31:00 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Another Image from yesterdays session - C/2014 Q2 - Using darken...
Greetings Comet Friends,

My first attempt to get a stationary comet using median combine on the image set was a mess, every time I strretched the image to see the very faint tail rays, the star streaks appeared all over the coma. Undaunted, I aligned all the images in Maxim, pasted 29 layers in PS, the combined with "darken". The results were much better, and the s/n still appears good. IVe added the new image to the top of yesterdays post...

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122214.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Wed, 24 Dec 2014 08:32:35 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014 Q2 on Dec 24 via itel Siding Spring
Martin,

Outstanding! I did the same trick last night with my 80mm and got over 7 degrees of tail.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Wed, 24 Dec 2014 09:53:04 -0800
From:  jnassr2010@yahoo.com
Subject:  C2014 Q2 Disconnection Event
Hi,

Two images on successive nights with identical equipment and exposures show the tail of Comet Lovejoy C2014 Q2 apparently dimming and undergoing a disconnection event!

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec23201477EDf43683L2x5minRGB5min_20141224114652.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec23201477EDf43683L2x5minRGB5min_20141224114652.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec24201477EDf43683L3x5minRGB5min_20141224114653.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec24201477EDf43683L3x5minRGB5min_20141224114653.jpg

John 

Date:  Thu, 25 Dec 2014 08:43:43 +1300
From:  john_drummond@xtra.co.nz
Subject:  Comet Lovejoy (C/2014 Q2) ~6 degree tail - 2014 Dec 24 UT
Hi,

I imaged C/2014 Q2 last night (2014 Dec 24.5 UT) with a Canon 70-200mm lens @ 76mm and f2.8. I add-stacked 10 x 3 minute @ 1600iso. The tail seems to be ~5.7 degrees long in a PA of 1 degree. Here’s a link - it isn't pretty, but I wanted to try to capture as much tail as possible...

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=105632

Merry Christmas to all!
==============================
John Drummond, Possum Observatory, IAU Code E94, Gisborne, New Zealand (177d 53' E, 38d 38' S)
Vote Drummond for 2016 Gisborne District Council - Drummond: Striving to maintain Gisborne's unique beauty & enjoy its natural resources...
Royal Astronomical Society of New Zealand vice president - www.rasnz.org.nz
Gisborne Astronomical Society president - www.astrogas.co.nz
GAS Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/gisborneastronomicalsociety?ref=stream&hc_location=timeline

Date:  Wed, 24 Dec 2014 22:50:51 +0100
From:  chrismlt@laposte.net
Subject:  Mars and comet 15P Finlay 22, 23 and 24 december
Dear all,

Mars and comet 15P were low above the SW horizon just after sunset, but the sky was reasonnably clear for 3 days, so I imaged the duos movement all 3 evenings with a FS102 f6 refractor.
You can see the images here :

http://millimagjournal.wordpress.com/cometes/

Merry Christmas,
Christophe

Joseph,
Its tail is fading indeed. It was very distinct in three second exposures Dec 23, but barely was visible at all even with 60 second exposures the night after. I wonder how it will fare tonight...

Date:  Thu, 25 Dec 2014 21:21:45 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  C2014Q2 Disconnection event recorded pretty good.
Greetings cometary friends,

Taken a few nights back, this set is the L data with our Ziess 80mm f/4.8 APO, and ST10xme CCD. Two frames to capture what appears to be around 7 degrees of tail or so. Trying to register the tail only half on the motion of the comet was a trick, when there is no head to lock onto! Add to that the tail itself is moving too. Oh my.

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122314.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Fri, 26 Dec 2014 08:44:25 -0800
From:  jnassr2010@yahoo.com
Subject:  Lovejoy C2014 Q2
Hi,

After the December 24 tail disconnection, the tail of Comet Lovejoy C2014 Q2 appears to be brightening again in these two images taken on December 25 and 26. The images are 3 degrees wide.

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec25201477EDf43683L3x5minRGB5min_20141226103504.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/LovejoyC2014Q2Dec25201477EDf43683L3x5minRGB5min_20141226103504.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpg

John 

Date:  Fri, 26 Dec 2014 11:44:07 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014Q2 color and b&w preview
Superb Gerald. You did an excellent job at piecing the two L channels together!

Chris

Date:  Fri, 26 Dec 2014 16:58:25 -0800
From:  jnassr2010@yahoo.com
Subject:  Second tail disconnection C2014 Q2
Hi,

The Dec 26 tail is AGAIN abruptly truncated at the upper portion and with a knot in the longer lower portion. These seems to indicate that the tail generating mechanism of the comet is sputtering.

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20R http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpgGB%205min.jpg http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpg

http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lov... http://stardustobservatory.org/upload/comets/comets_Lovejoy%20C2014%20Q2%20Dec%2026,%202014%2077ED%20f4,3%20683%20L%204x5min%20RGB%205min.jpg

A single 300s exposure with iTelescope's T31 20 inch CDK telescope. Field of view is 55 arcmin square.

Date:  Sat, 27 Dec 2014 14:24:11 +0100
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy: a detailed close-up (26 Dec. 2014)
Dear All,

we succeeded imaging this comet and, thanks to our focal length, we obtained a
detailed view of the inner ion tail:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/12/27/comet-c2014-q2-lovejoy-image-26-dec-2014/

Looking forward for a better position in teh sky soon,
Gianluca 

Date:  Sat, 27 Dec 2014 07:06:44 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy: a detailed close-up (26 Dec. 2014)
Gianluca, annother appropriate use of the median combine. This really brings up the contrast of the rays near the head, very nice processing job!
Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Sun, 28 Dec 2014 13:04:17 +0100
From:  Gianluca Masi 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2: some processing (26 Dec. 2014)
Dear All,

I applied a rotational gradient to our recent images of comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy,
bringing out a few features. You can see it on the bottom of this page:

http://www.virtualtelescope.eu/2014/12/27/comet-c2014-q2-lovejoy-image-26-dec-2014/

All the best
Gianluca

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Last nights Lovejoy Q2 - My best so far.
Greetings All,

A last hurah before the moon blows the comet away last night, here is a two part panorama with a field of around 6 degrees taken around 11pm Arizona time:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122714.html

I hope you had a chance to get one last one in!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Sun, 28 Dec 2014 17:46:53 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 Q2: some processing (26 Dec. 2014)
Gianluca, great stuff as usual., you can check the jets another way, using the HPF in photoshop. This also then allows you to put the jets into your comet shots to enchance the head details. Your work is always so educational. Dont stop.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Mon, 29 Dec 2014 10:15:59 +0100
From:  Gerald Rhemann 
Subject:  2014Q2 Disconnection event from yesterday - mosaic image
Hello everybody,

Processing of the color data will last - very difficult because of comets
motion and tails motion. Anyway here are some b&w previews. The one of
yesterday is one of my most spectacular comet images ever taken:

23. Dec:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/264_2014Q2_23_12.jpg

27.Dec:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/265_2014Q2_27_12.jpg

28.Dec - 6 Panel mosaic!!

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets
/266_2014Q2_28_12.jpg

best regards

Gerald
