#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317photos div label {
color:#666666;font-size:10px;overflow:hidden;text-align:center;white-space:nowrap;width:64px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317reco-category {
font-size:77%;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317reco-desc {
font-size:77%;}

#yiv5150288317 .yiv5150288317replbq {
margin:4px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-actbar div a:first-child {
margin-right:2px;padding-right:5px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg {
font-size:13px;font-family:Arial, helvetica, clean,
sans-serif;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg table {
font-size:inherit;font:100%;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg select,
#yiv5150288317 input, #yiv5150288317 textarea {
font:99% Arial, Helvetica, clean, sans-serif;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg pre, #yiv5150288317
code {
font:115% monospace;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg * {
line-height:1.22em;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mlmsg #yiv5150288317logo {
padding-bottom:10px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-msg p a {
font-family:Verdana;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-msg
p#yiv5150288317attach-count span {
color:#1E66AE;font-weight:700;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-reco
#yiv5150288317reco-head {
color:#ff7900;font-weight:700;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-reco {
margin-bottom:20px;padding:0px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-sponsor #yiv5150288317ov
li a {
font-size:130%;text-decoration:none;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-sponsor #yiv5150288317ov
li {
font-size:77%;list-style-type:square;padding:6px 0;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-sponsor #yiv5150288317ov
ul {
margin:0;padding:0 0 0 8px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-text {
font-family:Georgia;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-text p {
margin:0 0 1em 0;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-text tt {
font-size:120%;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-vital ul li:last-child {
border-right:none !important;
}
#yiv5150288317

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317 --

border:1px solid #d8d8d8;font-family:Arial;margin:10px
0;padding:0 10px;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mkp hr { border:1px solid #d8d8d8;}

#yiv5150288317 #yiv5150288317ygrp-mkp #yiv5150288317hd {
color:#628c2a;font-size:85%;font-weight:700;line-height:122%;margin:10px
0;}

margin-bottom:10px;}

Chris - SPECTACULAR
IMAGE!!!  Gerald  Von: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com]
Gesendet: Montag, 29. Dezember 2014
00:00
An: Comet Group
Betreff: [Comet-Images] Last nights
Lovejoy Q2 - My best so far.    Greetings All,

A last hurah before the moon
blows the comet away last night, here is a two part panorama
with a field of around 6 degrees taken around 11pm Arizona
time:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122714.html

I hope you had a chance to get
one last one in!

Clear
Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal:
http://www.schursastrophotography.com

On Mon, 12/29/14, 'Gerald Rhemann' gerald.rhemann@gmail.com [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] 2014Q2 Disconnection event from yesterday - mosaic image
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, December 29, 2014, 2:15 AM

Hello everybody,  Processing
of the color data will last – very difficult because
of comets motion and tails motion. Anyway here are some
b&w previews. The one of yesterday is one of my most
spectacular comet images ever taken:
 23. Dec:http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/264_2014Q2_23_12.jpg
 27.Dec:http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/265_2014Q2_27_12.jpg
 28.Dec – 6 Panel mosaic!!http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/266_2014Q2_28_12.jpg
 best regards
 Gerald

font-weight:normal;}

#yiv9434205891 div.yiv9434205891ygrp-file-title {
font-weight:bold;}
#yiv9434205891

#yiv9434205891 #yiv9434205891 --
#yiv9434205891ygrp-mkp {
border:1px solid #d8d8d8;font-family:Arial;margin:10px
0;padding:0 10px;}

#yiv9434205891 #yiv9434205891ygrp-mkp hr {
border:1px solid #d8d8d8;}

#yiv9434205891 #yiv9434205891ygrp-mkp #yiv9434205891hd {
color:#628c2a;font-size:85%;font-weight:700;line-height:122%;margin:10px
0;}

Date:  Mon, 29 Dec 2014 09:44:55 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 and M79 Last night - All about composition
Greetings Comet friends,

The view visually was pretty weak, both objects appeared as dim, and the comet overpowered the barely visible M79. But what a great imaging challenge! The comet actually had tail rays right over the cluster, and the green from the coma began to wash over it. Here is what i got from my backyard here in northern Arizona, with my 12.5" newt:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122814.html

I also got the pair with the Stellarvue, thats coming later.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Mon, 29 Dec 2014 10:16:42 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] comet C/2014 Q2 + M79 large field
Rolando, I like this one best, the tail is spectacular in your rendition!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

From: "Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"
To: Comet Group
Sent: Monday, 29 December 2014, 17:44
Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2014 Q2 and M79 Last night - All about composition

  Greetings Comet friends,

The view visually was pretty weak, both objects appeared as dim, and the comet overpowered the barely visible M79. But what a great imaging challenge! The comet actually had tail rays right over the cluster, and the green from the coma began to wash over it. Here is what i got from my backyard here in northern Arizona, with my 12.5" newt:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122814.html

I also got the pair with the Stellarvue, thats coming later.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 Q2 and M79 Last night - All about composition
Thanks Damian! This is one instance where using darken to combine the stack of lums worked 10x better than median. BUT when I do the wide field stuff, median brings up more faint tail.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

From: "Chris Schur
comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"


To: Comet
Group

Sent: Monday,
29 December 2014, 17:44
Subject: [Comet-Images]
C/2014 Q2 and M79 Last night - All about composition

Greetings
Comet friends,

The view visually was pretty weak, both objects appeared as
dim, and the comet overpowered the barely visible M79. But
what a great imaging challenge! The comet actually had tail
rays right over the cluster, and the green from the coma
began to wash over it. Here is what i got from my backyard
here in northern Arizona, with my 12.5" newt:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/lovejoyQ2122814.html

I also got the pair with the Stellarvue, thats coming
later.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal:
http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Comet page:

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/Comets.html 

Date:  Tue, 30 Dec 2014 16:13:56 +0100

Subject:  C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy: close-up (29 Dec. 2014)

Gianluca

Date:  Wed, 31 Dec 2014 10:08:05 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Image C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy)


Image of comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy taken on December 26, 2014, showing a complex structured tail with jets extending toward north. Its coma with 25' apparent diameter, maintains its main composition of C2 indicated by an intense green color.
GSO 8" f/4 Reflector + Canon EOS 350D camera (8×150 sec. at ISO 1600)From Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)
http://cometografia.es/cola-estructurada-lovejoy/

Happy New Year.

José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Wed, 31 Dec 2014 11:21:26 +0000
From:  jean-gabriel bosch 
Subject:  86P Wild 3 (rediscovery) 2014-12-30
Hello,
86P Wild 3 (rediscovery)
last observation 2008 06 03.05
Chance that it is the year of the death of its discoverer Paul Wild (born October 5, 1925 and died July 2, 2014 in Bern) is a Swiss astronomer who discovered several comets.

So rediscovered by a Swiss (Me ;))
Remote T400RC SpaceObs A.Maury
86P Wild 3
Best regards,
http://transitionsciel.blogspot.fr/

Date:  Wed, 31 Dec 2014 07:59:42 -0800
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Image C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy)
Jose, an outstanding shot indeed. I have an Orion 8" f/4 astrograph, which is made by GSO. When used with the Baader MPCC corrector, it is a magnificent instrument.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Image of comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy taken on December
26, 2014, showing a complex structured tail
with jets extending toward north. Its coma with 25'
apparent diameter, maintains its main
composition of C2 indicated by an intense green
color.

at ISO 1600)From Hoya Redonda,
